triples.name: Language acquisition
triples.relevance: Foundation concept for understanding how lexical acquisition occurs in language learning.

triples.name: Word-sense disambiguation
triples.relevance: Core task for identifying correct word meanings in context, essential to lexical acquisition systems.

triples.name: Information retrieval
triples.relevance: Application domain where lexical acquisition techniques are applied for information retrieval systems.

triples.name: WordNet
triples.relevance: Key lexical database artifact that organizes semantic relations between words for NLP applications.

triples.name: Natural language processing
triples.relevance: Broader field in which lexical acquisition and semantic lexicon development are core components.

triples.name: Machine translation
triples.relevance: Application domain where understanding lexical semantics and word senses is critical for translation quality.

triples.name: Polysemy
triples.relevance: Linguistic phenomenon where words have multiple related meanings, central challenge in lexical semantics.

triples.name: Corpus linguistics
triples.relevance: Empirical method using text corpora for extracting lexical statistics and linguistic patterns.

triples.name: Lexicon
triples.relevance: Building and structuring lexicons is the main goal and output of lexical acquisition systems.
